intro: Centaurium erythraea var. limoniiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in moist meadows, grasslands, and along streambanks. This variety is distinguished by its elongated, narrow leaves, which give it its specific epithet "limoniiforme."
